title: HUL to Remove Lakme Sunscreen Ad Following Derma Co Dispute
summary: Hindustan Unilever Limited (HUL) has agreed to withdraw and modify its Lakme brand advertisements that allegedly disparaged Honasa Consumer Limited's Derma Co brand, as per their statement to the Delhi High Court.
content:
Hindustan Unilever Limited (HUL), the owner of the Lakme brand, made a formal commitment to the Delhi High Court on Thursday regarding the modification of their advertising content. The company stated it would withdraw and republish its advertisements after removing all references that allegedly disparage the Derma Co brand, owned by Honasa Consumer Limited.

The decision comes amid growing concerns about comparative advertising and brand disparagement in the cosmetics industry. The case highlights the legal boundaries companies must observe when creating competitive marketing campaigns.
